summary: Innovations in healthcare and care systems have been the focus of my work for over ten years. I believe that design & design processen shape these healthcare innovations and are crucial to develop a sustainable healthcare system. Driven by curiosity and an open mind, I design innovative concepts for healthy living. Connecting stakeholders and joining different interests is key in my approach, and the main driver of Studio Junctuur.

[{'title': 'Mobiles for Good - challenge', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'The Mobiles for Good Challenge is an initiative of Vodafone Foundation in cooperation with Waag Society. The challenge aims to develop mobile healthcare (mHealth) services and applications, to provide support and qualitative health care.

In 2012 the first edition of the challenge was organised. In september 2013 the winners of the second challenge were announced at the Emerce EHealth conference in Amsterdam. As of April 2014 the third edition of the Challenge has started.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Danielle', 'last_name': 'Puma', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Owner of Studio Binnen - interior design. Ga jij verbouwen of verhuizen en wil jij graag jouw droomhuis realiseren?  Wij maken graag een ontwerp voor je!'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Sabine', 'last_name': 'Wildevuur', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Impact, Citizen Science, Responsible Design, Transdisciplinarity, Person-Centred eHealth'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Paulien', 'last_name': 'Melis', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Studio Junctuur - verbindt ontwerp & zorg'}]}, {'title': 'Trusted Healthcare Services - COMMIT', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'In integrated healthcare systems, a large variety of providers and other stakeholders are involved. This work package identifies requirements for trusted healthcare, focusing on the 2 use cases: professional home healthcare services, and health communities.

On the basis of literature search and interviews with experts and users, this work package within the THeCS project establishes the trust requirements. The work package will study the trustworthiness of services and the relationship between transparency, privacy and security.

Further, the work package studies the legal requirements regarding division of responsibilities and applicable legal data protection regime (e.g. data protection law, health law, regulations regarding the identification of citizens, both general and healthcare specific, and databases law).

A user driven approach is taken; in which the users (different stakeholders) will be involved from the beginning. The methodology of involving users through a service design approach is applied through for example co-creation workshops with the different stakeholders. In this way the developed technology will meet the needs and demands of the users. Furthermore, I'm involved to market our know-how and prototypes.
